qas.question: Who organized the Concert for the People of Kampuchea?
In what year was Queen's Live Killers released?
How many times platinum did Queen's Live Killers go in the US?
Queen's Crazy Little Thing Called Love was an ode to which singer?
In what year did Queen play the Concert for the People of Kampuchea?

context: In 1978, Queen toured the US and Canada, and spent much of 1979 touring in Europe and Japan. They released their first live album, Live Killers, in <a1_0>1979<a1_0/>; it went platinum <a2_0>twice<a2_0/> in the US. Queen also released the very successful single "Crazy Little Thing Called Love", a rockabilly inspired song done in the style of <a3_0>Elvis Presley<a3_0/>. The song made the top 10 in many countries, topped the Australian ARIA Charts for seven consecutive weeks, and was the band's first number one single in the United States where it topped the Billboard Hot 100 for four weeks. Having written the song on guitar and played rhythm on the record, Mercury played rhythm guitar while performing the song live, which was the first time he ever played guitar in concert. In December <a4_0>1979<a4_0/>, Queen played the opening night at the Concert for the People of Kampuchea in London, having accepted a request by the event's organiser <a0_0>Paul McCartney<a0_0/>.
